title: Here’s what Boston meteorologists are saying about the timing and impacts of the Sunday-Monday nor’easter
author: John Waller
bullets: The upcoming nor'easter is expected to bring heavy snow, strong winds, and coastal flooding to southeast Massachusetts and Rhode Island.
Meteorologists predict up to a foot of snow for metro Boston, with higher amounts possible on the South Shore and Cape Cod.
Power outages are a concern due to heavy, wet snow and strong winds as the storm path suggests significant impact early next week.

title: Alex Bregman declines to respond to Sam Kennedy’s comments about player’s Red Sox departure
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman chose not to discuss his departure from the Red Sox despite comments from team president Sam Kennedy.
Bregman signed with the Chicago Cubs, prioritizing a no-trade clause not offered by the Red Sox.
Sam Kennedy implied Bregman could have stayed with the Red Sox, drawing attention and fan reactions online.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Apocalypse Now (Redux), honoring the late Robert Duvall, is streaming on Pluto TV and Plex.
Richard Linklater's 'Blue Moon' is now available on Netflix, featuring Ethan Hawke in a biopic of lyricist Lorenz Hart.
Jennifer Garner stars in Season 2 of 'The Last Thing He Told Me,' now streaming on Apple TV.

title: Red Sox INF Marcelo Mayer has to earn spot on Opening Day roster, Alex Cora says
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox manager Alex Cora says Marcelo Mayer must improve offensively to secure a spot on Opening Day roster.
Marcelo Mayer, drafted fourth overall in 2021, missed part of his rookie season due to a wrist injury.
Mayer is competing for infield positions; he's practicing at second base while Caleb Durbin practices at third.

title: 7 maps predicting snowfall totals Sunday-Monday
author: John Waller
bullets: Meteorologists predict heavy snow and strong winds in southeast MA and RI from Sunday night into Monday.
The National Weather Service signals potential for heavy coastal flooding and power outages due to a nor'easter.
Snowfall estimates for Boston and South Shore indicate a foot or more, with major impacts across the region.

title: Lindsay Clancy appears in court for first in-person hearing since allegedly killing her children
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Lindsay Clancy appeared in Plymouth Superior Court for the first time in-person since the alleged murder of her children.
Clancy faces charges for the murder and strangulation of her three children in Duxbury, reportedly influenced by mental illness.
A bifurcated trial is requested for Clancy, focusing separately on guilt and mental state during the alleged killings.

title: Cape Cod adopts transfer fee on home sales over $1 million
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Barnstable County Assembly approved a real estate transfer fee for homes over $1 million, expected to generate $60 million annually.
The fee proposal, pending state legislature approval, allows towns to set fees from 0.5% to 4% on sales above $1 million.
90% of collected fees will be returned to towns for housing initiatives, with 10% funding regional housing administration.

title: Peabody police warn about ‘Northshore Mall takeover’
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Peabody police alerted the public about a planned 'Northshore Mall takeover' scheduled for 3 p.m. on Friday.
Authorities are coordinating with local and state agencies to manage crowds and ensure public safety during the event.
These events, involving car activities blocking streets, have previously escalated to violence and property damage in Massachusetts.

title: 7 members of ‘Harvard Street Gang’ face drug and firearms charges, authorities say
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Seven members of the Brockton-based Harvard Street Gang face drug and firearms charges, per U.S. Attorney's Office.
Authorities seized 25 firearms, kilograms of drugs, and tens of thousands in cash in Eastern Massachusetts raids.
Court documents reveal the gang's involvement in drug trafficking and firearms offenses since 2019.

title: Al Horford says his decision to leave Celtics was ‘deeper than just the basketball’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Al Horford left the Celtics to join the Warriors, citing reasons beyond basketball such as money and opportunities.
Horford mentioned non-basketball related factors influenced his decision to leave, promising to share more details later.
Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla praised Horford as a Hall-of-Famer and appreciated their time working together.
